section.title: XML
section.para: In this section of the book I will explain different XML applications.

section.title: XSLT
section.abs:def: Extensible stylesheet language transformation (XSLT) is a language for transforming XML documents into other XML documents.
section.para: A list of XSL elements and what they do..

tr.td: The xsl:stylesheet element is always the top-level element of an XSL stylesheet. The name xsl:transform may be used as a synonym.
The xsl:template element has an optional mode attribute. If this is present, the template will only be matched when the same mode is used in the invoking xsl:apply-templates element.
The xsl:for-each element causes iteration over the nodes selected by a node-set expression.

section.title: XPath
section.abs:def: XPath (XML Path Language) is a terse (non-XML) syntax for addressing portions of an XML document.

tr.td: The format-number function converts its first argument to a string using the format pattern string specified by the second argument and the decimal-format named by the third argument, or the default decimal-format, if there is no third argument
The current function returns a node-set that has the current node as its only member.
The generate-id function returns a string that uniquely identifies the node in the argument node-set that is first in document order.

section.title: Documentation frameworks
section.para: One of the most important documentation frameworks is Docbook.
The other is the topic oriented DITA, promoted by OASIS.
